title: How to Make Egg Salad

steps.headline: Place 6 eggs in a saucepan or other pot.
Cover the eggs with cool water.
steps.description: Make sure there is between ½ and 1 inch (15 to 25mm) of water above the eggs. Add a dash of salt to the water.

steps.headline: Place the lid on the pan.
steps.description: Bring the pan to a very gentle boil on medium to medium high heat, depending upon how quickly your burner heats up.

steps.headline: Turn the burner off.
steps.description: Let the eggs sit for 7 minutes with the lid on.

steps.headline: Make a bowl of ice water that is big enough to hold all the eggs.
Pour out the hot water.
steps.description: Place the hot eggs in the ice bath for 3 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Crack each of the hard-boiled eggs.
steps.description: Peel them carefully to avoid egg shells in your salad.

steps.headline: Place them inside a medium-sized bowl.
Add 2 tablespoons (30ml) of mayonnaise.
steps.description: You can add Greek yogurt instead if you are looking for a healthier option. You may also choose to do 1 tbsp. (15ml) of mayonnaise and 1 of yogurt.

steps.headline: Mash the eggs and mayonnaise with a fork.
steps.description: You can mash it up very small or leave the egg pieces larger for a different texture.

steps.headline: Add salad seasonings.
steps.description: Choose from a variety of common egg salad seasonings. Mix them in well with a large spoon. Add pepper to taste. If you do not plan to put packaged condiments in the salad, you may want to add a dash of salt as well. For a sweet taste, add 1 tsp. (5ml) of sweet relish. Increase the amount according to your preference. Add 2 stalks of chopped celery for a crunchy texture. Add 1 tsp. of dill or 1/2 tsp. (3g) of onion salt. Add 1/2 cup (44g) of chopped onion or chopped chives. Other condiment choices include mustard and lemon juice.

steps.headline: Decide whether you will serve the salad plain or as a sandwich.
steps.description: Wash and dry a bed of lettuce, if you want to serve the egg salad without bread. Spoon the egg salad on top of the lettuce. This egg salad recipe serves 4. Toast 2 pieces of bread. Spread some butter on the toast, if desired. Lay down 2 pieces of lettuce on the top piece of bread. Spoon egg salad onto the bottom piece of bread. Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

steps.headline: Boil and peel the eggs.
Dice your eggs and put them in a bowl.
Add 5 drops of mustard for every egg.
Add a large spoonful of relish for every egg.
Add a medium sized spoonful of mayonnaise for every egg.
Dice up 1/12 of an onion.
Add it to the mix.
Stir the batch well with spoon.
Add a dash or two of pepper.
Squeeze some lemon juice (only 2 squeezes maximum).
Stir well again.
Chill for 30 minutes.
Serve with lettuce or bread.
